subject: Management
title: The Rule of Seven
description: A quick, practical guide to The Rule of Seven.

hook.text: A leader announced the change once. Three months later, half the organization hadn't heard of it.

buildup.text: Marketing rule: people need to hear a message seven times before it sticks. Change is the same.

discovery.text: Repeat the vision in every meeting, every email, every town hall. Consistency builds understanding.

twist.text: By the time you're sick of saying it, people are just starting to hear it.

climax.text: Use multiple channels: email, meetings, videos, one-on-ones. Different people absorb differently.

punchline.text: When you're tired of saying it, say it seven more times.

quiz.question: Why must change messages be repeated many times?
options: People need to hear a message roughly seven times before it truly registers
One well-crafted announcement is always sufficient
Repeating messages annoys employees and reduces engagement
